银行组件是创建和管理[Bank Accounts]的地方。公民可以为自己创建多个帐户，也可以与其他公民共享帐户。帐户也可以分配给[Titles]和[Demographics]。
帐户用户可以使用该帐户执行交易（添加和删除资金）。

column1: 客户经理可以更改经理列表和用户列表中的用户，重命名帐户并执行交易。在高级设置中，您可以将帐户设置为游戏俱乐部帐户。
游戏俱乐部帐户可以接收和支付税收资金，在收取税收和计算个人财富时将被忽略。要进行此设置，您必须具有由[Elected Title|Elected Titles]分配的游戏俱乐部银行特权。

column2: 银行组件用于创建和管理银行帐户
合同公告板允许公民发布和接受[Contracts]和[Work Parties]，从而允许公民之间执行强制劳动和其他协议。
订立合同
在发布合同时，可以根据需要制定任意数量的条款，每个条款都可以制定为描述所请求的工作。必须满足每一项条款合同才会被认定为完成。

column1: 当“自动接受”被选择时，系统会自动检测到合同的完成。例如，如果一份合同被设定为在两点之间修建一条道路，执行该工作的承包商可以在其侧边菜单中打开该合同，并按下“工作完成”，这将触发检测工作是否确实完成。如果是，合同将按协议交付并自动结束。
“自定义条款”是一种特殊条款，允许玩家用语言描述他们想要做的事情。如果一个合同包含这样的条款，它必须由客户手动批准(自动接受此时不可用)，因为自动检测不能确定何时完成。
当自动检测未启用时，如果承包人认为任务已经完成，他们就可以点击“任务完成”，然后承包人就会接受或拒绝完成任务。没有自动接受的合同要求公民之间有更多的信任，因为不能保证承包商会诚实地接受完成的工作。建议公民在这些情况下使用[Reputation]作为确定声望的一种手段。
合同有一个固定的时间限制，这个限制需在制定合同时确定。此外，可以将合同设置为可重复进行——当启用此功能时，每次接受一个合同时，重复计数器将减少1。
合同有效时，为合同提供的任何款项都会保存在特殊的托管帐户[Bank Account|Bank Accounts]中。 如果合同成功完成，则该款项将转移给承包商，如果失败，则将退还给客户。 承包商也可以收取押金，该押金将由第三方保管，并在成功完成后退还给承包商，或者在失败时退还给客户。

column2: 工作小组

column1: [Work Parties]也可以张贴在合同公告板上，允许创建可由其他多个公民完成的任务，而不是仅由两方之间达成协议的合同。在发布工作组之前，公民必须在其拥有的手工桌子上开始工作指令。
发布工作组后，劳工可以在合同公告板中加入该项目。默认情况下，任何人都可以以劳动者的身份加入工作组，但是可以为每个人加入的个人角色或一般要求设置要求。选中“将角色扩展为“满员””后，将在填补所有角色后自动创建新的劳工栏位。
在设置所需的工作时，工作组的发布者可以决定雇用劳动力，资源或两者兼而有之。向工作组捐款的任何公民都将根据他们提供的工作量获得一定比例的付款。通过为工作组中的特定工作分配额外的权重，该工作将获得更高的付款份额
工作组有多种支付方式，每个工作组也可以使用多种支付方式。
-使用[Currency]作为支付方式时，可以使用“随用随付”的选项，它将按劳工的贡献度来支付，而不是在合同完成时一次性付清。
-使用[Reputation]作为支付方式时，工作组完成后所有参与工作的公民将平分声望值。
-使用[Research]作为支付方式时，所有参与工作的公民将在工作组结束后立即发现该技术。仅当工作组正在创建研究书时，或者提供工作组的公民在发布工作组时其库存中有研究书时，才可以将研究作为支付方式。
-授予[Title|Titles]作为支付方式时，发布合同的公民必须是所提供头衔的管理员。所有达到最低贡献值的公民将被授予新头衔。访问类型确定他们是否成为头衔管理员或头衔所有者。

column1: 选择[Bank Accounts]时，公民可以选择已被授予访问权限的任何帐户（在[Bank Component]中执行）。默认情况下，将选择公民的个人帐户。
可以在信用组件中选择世界上任何一种[Currencies|Currency]。这将指定对某物品上发生的任何交易时采用的货币（例如[Store|Store Component]将接受此处设置的任何货币）。
当为商店中的货币选择为无时，无需货币就可以进行直接交易。

Objects with a [Crafting Component] can define a fee for authorized citizens to use them. The settings in the Credit Component will determine what currency that fee is charged in and what account the funds are deposited to.

column2: The Credit Component allows citizens to set the bank account and currency for transactions on an object.
契据销售组件允许公民购买和出售[Property]

column1: 通过访问[Real Estate Desk|Real Estate Desk Item]，公民可以为其契据创建清单，并查看其他市民的清单。可以从任何房地产服务台查看所有发布的列表。
创建清单时，业主设置价格以及使用的[Currency]。所有收入都将进入所选的[Bank Account|Bank Accounts]。
购买契据时，货币将从购买者选择的银行帐户中提取。
房产出售后，契据和契据中包含的所有物体均会移交给新所有者

column2: 契据销售组件允许公民购买和出售房产。
货币兑换组件允许公民将一种[Currency]换成另一种货币。
货币兑换

column1: [CurrencyExchangeItem]的所有者可以使用货币兑换组件向其他公民提供货币兑换。设置交易所时，所有者的货币是要出售的货币。对于购买的每单位所有者货币，将向公民收取设定的替代货币金额。
当[Authorized Consumer|Authorization Component]访问货币交易所时，他们会看到所有提供兑换的货币列表。默认情况下，所有公民都是授权消费者

column2: 兑换限制

column1: 货币兑换组件的所有者可以选择设置余额限制。如果所选帐户中的货币数量不符合限制，将会阻止公民兑换货币。
左边的数字是最小货币持有量，右边的数字是最大货币持有量。如果设置为0，则代表没有限制。

column2: 允许公民设立货币交易所。
物品分发组件允许所有者发起慈善捐赠，向新公民提供免费物品，促进前期发展。

column1: 所有符合条件的新公民（根据他们玩了多长时间）都可以访问[DistributionStationItem]来领取他们的物品。进入世界后，新公民将在大地图上看到标记，以提醒他们有物品可领取。请注意，[Storage Component]必须包含所分发的物品，这样新公民才能领取它们。
所有者可以指定要分发的物品，每件物品的数量以及公民必须玩多久才能获得领取资格。

column2: 允许所有者发起慈善捐赠，向新公民提供免费物品，促进前期发展。
铸币厂组件允许公民创建由资源担保的[Currencies|Currency]。

column1: 在[MintItem]创建货币时，必须选择一种物品作为担保，以及消耗没单位物品生成的货币数量。通过设置担保物，可以将可能的货币总量限制为所提供担保物的数量，避免大量新货币冲击市场从而保证稳定性。选择的担保物会影响这一点，因为更稀有物品通常更难获得，因此可以提供更高的稳定性。
每个担保物对应的货币数量是永久性的，因此在选择担保物时请多加注意。货币铸造后，铸币厂将会与创建的货币绑定，即便铸币厂被移动。
在[Authorization Component]中被授予使用权利的公民可以使用铸币厂组件铸造其他货币。可以将货币铸造到所有者选择的目标[Bank Account|Bank Accounts]中，也可以铸造给任何[Bank Component]中公民可以访问的银行帐户中。

column2: 允许公民创建和铸造担保货币。

column1: 商店组件允许公民设置他们希望从购买或出售的物品。这些操作可以自动发生，不需要商店所有者在线。
在[Credit Component]中选择的货币和银行帐户将用于商店中的所有交易。当为商店中的货币选择为“无”时，可以进行不需缴纳营业税的直接交易。

A store owner can link specific containers in the [Storage Component] to pick which items are considered part of the store's inventory. By default, all nearby storage containers are linked to the store when it is first placed.
When creating a Sale List, only the price needs to be set. The inventory for a Sale List is determined automatically by the availability of items in the linked storage containers.

When creating a Purchase List, the price and Max to Buy quantity for each item must be decided. If the Max to Buy quantity is left at zero, the store will continue to purchase items until the linked containers are full. If a Max to Buy quantity is specified, citizens can sell that item until the linked storage contains that amount.
For tools with durability, a minimum durability to buy/sell can be set, and only items of that durability or higher will be eligible for trade via the store.

column2: Sets up an interface for other citizens to buy and sell goods from/to you automatically.

column1: 公民行动组件允许公民参与[Elections]，执行[Executive Actions]以及辞职，这取决于所使用的对象

column2: 参加推选

column1: 在[投票箱|投票箱项目]使用公民行动组件时，公民可以竞选[推选头衔]并参加推选。通过按下“投票”按钮，玩家将被重定向到Web界面，在这里他们可以查看所有正在进行的[Elections]（推选），与他们的同胞讨论，使用[Data]提供论证证据并投票。在当前的[Election Process | Election Processs]中获得否决权的公民可以立即颠覆推选。要竞选民选头衔，首先，符合条件的公民必须使用“开始推选”行动。推选开始后，符合条件的公民可以选择“参加推选”参加比赛并发表竞选演讲。候选人可以随时使用投票箱上的选项选择退出推选

column2: 执行行政行动

column1: 通过在[行政办公室|行政办公室项目]使用公民行动组件，可以使民选职务执行一次影响一系列公民的行政行动。公民条件规定了行政行为适用于哪些公民，并且可以为公民设定质量的多个条件。要对所有公民执行某项操作，请使用[Demographic]“所有人”作为公民条件。一旦批准行政行动，对每个公民的行动将立即生效。每个符合条件的公民可以一次执行多项行动

column2: 游戏俱乐部的行动

column1: 在[Government Office | Government Office Item]，公民行动组件允许民选职务辞职或将其他民选职务撤职。 “辞职”行动使任何当选官员都能辞职。如果创建后继头衔分配给当选头衔，将从拥有该头衔的所有公民中随机选出新官员；否则，当选头衔将空缺。 “罢免官员”行动允许已被授予权力的公民将当选头衔免职。寻找继任者的规则与正式辞职时相同

column2: 允许公民参加推选和执行行政行为。

column2: 公民职责
在“市民对象”组件中，您将看到[市民职责]的列表。鉴于目前的《章程》，这将告知公民他们对公民物品具有哪些许可。:

注册服务商组件允许创建和管理非推选[Titles]。这些头衔可用于与[Elected Titles] 相同的目的，但它们是由书记官长任命的。
分配头衔
头衔管理员可以重命名头衔并分配新的管理员和头衔持有者。头衔管理员不被视为头衔用户。所有权使用者是被视为所有权持有人的公民，并会获得所有相关的利益和条件
高级设置

column1: 在“高级设置”中，可以设置头衔持有者的要求，并且可以将小时工资分配给有资格的头衔持有者。在确定办公室持有人需要什么时，可以设置各种条件。如果公民未能遵守这些要求，他们将失去其作为“头衔用户”的分配。通过使用“一组条件”，可以为头衔持有者设置多个要求。工资是从头衔管理者已被允许在[银行组件] 中使用的任何[银行帐户|银行帐户] 中支付给头衔用户的。每小时（取决于世界设置）将工资支付给每个头衔用户的个人帐户。工资类型可用于从工资中排除离线时间

column2: 允许创建和管理非推选头衔。
库房组件允许已被授予“在库房设置税款”的权利的[当选职位]调整税率并选择“世界默认货币”。
税
在“库房组件”中设置[税]后，它们会自动应用于所有相关交易。所有收入都进入库房[银行帐户|银行帐户]。具有“游戏俱乐部银行特权”设置的选定头衔可以直接从金库帐户进行交易（允许在[信用组件]中选择该帐户）。钱也可以通过[Laws]从金库中出来，向公民付款。
世界默认货币
世界默认货币是放置包含信用成分的新对象时使用的默认[Currency]。公民仍然可以选择使用[Trade]中的任何货币，但是拥有世界默认货币可以更轻松地建立具有通用货币的经济。
直接税
具有“在金库设置税”的权利的当选头衔可以直接向公民征税或分配资金。这是通过管理所需货币并选择该操作将应用于哪些公民来完成的。当选头衔必须始终说明他们执行此操作的原因，该原因将显示给所有公民。资金管理还包括从资金帐户中转出货币的选项。这将永久删除货币，因此在对备用货币使用此功能时请务必小心。
允许拥有推选权并获得税收许可的公民设置税款并选择“世界默认货币”。

授权构成允许指定公民对对象具有哪些权限。

column1: The Deed displayed here is simply a link to the deed of the [Property] which the object is on (or the deed associated with the [Vehicle|Vehicle Component] if it is one).

Authorized Consumers can be listed here, either as specific people, [Titles], or [Demographics].  Anyone listed can interact with the object without having full control.  A store, for example, will allow citizens with consumer rights to buy and sell there, but only citizens with full rights to the property may change what is for sale, or move the store itself.
All placed objects have authorization components.

column2: Allows citizens to set the access rights of a given object.
Beds allow citizens to accelerate time when all citizens are using it simultaneously (or offline).

column1: (This feature is disabled by default on dedicated servers to prevent accelerating time when users are offline, but can be enabled by a server administrator.)

column2: Allows sleeping in single-player servers or servers where sleep is enabled.
Components related to industry.

column1: The Crafting Component is used to [Craft|Crafting] items, add resources or labor, and cancel existing projects. When contributing to a [Work Party|Work Parties], the Crafting Component can be accessed by citizens who have joined the work party.

column2: Crafting Items

column1: After selecting an item and quantity to craft, resources and labor are required to start the project. These resources can be added manually (placing them directly on the crafting table) or by linking a [Storage Component] that contains them.

Citizens with a related [Specialty|Specialties] require less calories to add labor. Some projects required skilled labor from a citizen with the corresponding specialty. This reduction is applied after the work order is started so citizens of various skill level can contribute to the same work party.
By adding an upgrade in the [Modules Component], work orders on a crafting table will have reduced crafting time and resource costs.
If a project is cancelled early (by right clicking the order), the resources will be refunded but the spent labor will be lost.

column2: Adding Labor

column1: For every unit of labor needed, [Calories|Nutrition] are consumed. After a work order is started, citizens can add labor by pressing the 'Work' button in the Crafting Component.

Once a project is started, labor can quickly be added from outside the Crafting Component by right clicking on a crafting table. When adding labor in this way, holding down 'Ctrl' will add 5x the normal amount of labor. Holding down 'Alt' will add all available calories.

column2: Tagged Ingredients

column1: Some recipes use Tagged Ingredients that can accept similar items as inputs. For example, an item may specify it needs 'Rock', and will accept any type of rock with that tag ([GraniteItem], [BasaltItem], etc).
Tagged ingredients will be consumed automatically, so there is no need to create separate orders using the different ingredients.

column2: Parent Recipes

column1: Some recipes are part of larger group of recipes, known as Parent Recipes. When crafting one of these recipes, a citizen may select a specific variation to produce. The number crafted will be the quantity selected for the parent recipe.
By default only recipes that have available resources will be displayed. By checking 'Show All', all possible variations will be displayed.

column2: The Crafting Component is used to craft items and add labor to projects.
The Module Component allows citizens to insert upgrades into their [Crafting] tables. After inserting an upgrade, work orders on that table will have reduced resource costs and crafting times.
Using Upgrades

column1: Upgrades come in five different quality levels. A level 1 upgrade decreases the resource cost and craft time by 10%, with each progressive level adding an additional decrease.

Crafting tables accept different types of upgrades. Early tables accept 'Basic Upgrades', while later tables require 'Advanced Upgrades' or 'Modern Upgrades'. Each tier of upgrade has five different quality levels, with the highest quality level being a Specialty Upgrade.
Some recipes have costs using Static Ingredients. Static ingredients are not affected by the resource cost reduction, but the recipes that contain them still get a reduction for crafting time.

column2: 专业升级

column1: The highest level of upgrade can only be crafted by a citizen who has reached the maximum level in their chosen [Specialty|Specialties]. Unlike other upgrades, these upgrades recieve an additional cost reduction when crafting recipes using the specified profession.

Some specialties have different tiers of upgrades that correspond to different crafting tables. For example, [CarpentrySkill] has the [CarpentryBasicUpgradeItem] for the [CarpentryTableItem] and the [CarpentryAdvancedUpgradeItem] for the [SawmillItem].

column2: Allows citizens to upgrade their crafting tables.

column1: The Pipe Component allows a citizen to check the status of an object’s smog output, water usage, and sewage flow.

column2: Smog Output

column1: By checking the Smog Output tooltip, a citizen can find additional information about the current object’s pollution output and the world’s [Pollution] levels.
Pipes can be used to redirect the flow of the air pollution. The pipes containing the Smog Output can have multiple inputs but must have only one open end, outside of all rooms, and above the object.
Objects that emit smog pollution only pollute when the object is active.

column2: Water and Sewage

column1: Objects with a Water Input and pumps with a Water Output connect through a system of pipes. Water pipes systems can have multiple inputs for water pumps and multiple outputs for each object with a water demand.

By checking the water tooltip in the Pipe Component, a citizen can see exactly how much water an object is producing or consuming. If there is not enough water being produced, objects will start to become inactive.

Pipes containing Sewage Output function similar to water pipes, but the [Sewage] they contain is a source of ground pollution. After [Waste Filters|Waste Filter Item] are invented, the sewage output can be piped into to a filter to mitigate the ground pollution.

column2: The Pipe Component allows a citizen to check the status of an object’s smog output and water usage.
The Power Component is used to check the status of local power grid. It is also used to check the consumption of objects that require fuel to operate.
燃料

column1: Objects that consume fuel will can have fuel input here, and each may require different types of fuel to operate. The tooltips for the accepted fuel contain a list of specific items that can be used to fuel the object. Fuel can also be added from the [Storage Component].

While operating, an object consumes fuel every second, measured in Watts (W). Each type of fuel contains a different amount of potential energy, measured in Joules (J). For every 1 Watt needed per second, 1 Joule of energy is consumed. Fuel is not consumed while the object is inactive.

column2: Energy Stats

column1: There are two types of [Power] that can be used by an object, Electric and Mechanical. The power grid displays the type and availability of the needed power for this object. If there is not enough power supply to match the power demanded, objects will become inactive.
Power generators that consume fuel become inactive if there are no nearby objects demanding power. There is no need to turn them on and off to conserve fuel.

column2: The Power Component is used to check the supply and demand for power and fuel.
The Repair Component allows citizens to repair tools at a [ToolBenchItem].

column1: After inserting a broken tool, the repair costs will appear. Advanced tools can be repaired for less resources by citizens with the corresponding [Specialty|Specialties]. The resources used can be manually added by a citizen or taken from a linked container in the [Storage Component].

The owner of a Tool Bench can allow other citizens access to repair their own tools for a fee set in the [Credit Component]. When offering tool repair to the public, consumer rights must be given in the [Authorization Component].

column2: Allows citizens to repair tools.

column1: The Status Component allows citizens to see the requirements for an object to be active, and which of those requirements are met. If an object causes [Pollution], the status component also shows the lifetime pollution production for that object.

column2: Object Status

column1: Each condition in the Status Component must be satisfied before an object can be active.  Some examples of conditions include:
- Being contained in a valid [Room|Rooms]
- Having enough [Power]
- A working [Sewage] system

column2: Status Indicator

column1: When interacting with an object with a Status Component, citizens can quickly see the status of the object by checking the status indicator in the top left corner. A green circle means an object is active while a red circle means it is inactive.

column2: Displays if an object is active or inactive and why.
The Storage Component is used to manage the inventory of storage containers and link them to objects that need storage.
Managing Storage

column1: Inventory can be moved between containers by dragging stacks of items from one container to another.

Holding down the 'Shift' key while dragging items will move all stacks of the same item between containers. Right clicking a stack of items will allow a player to divide a stack into smaller quantities. Holding down ‘Ctrl’ when clicking a stack of items will split the stack in half.
Some storage containers, like a [StockpileItem], can contain any type of item. Other storage containers, like a [StorageChestItem], can only contain non-carriable items.

column2: Linking Storage Containers

column1: 通过选中容器的复选框，可以将对象链接到存储组件中的容器。链接后，对象就可以访问容器中的所有项目，并且可以使用容器进行存储。链接存储容器时，将首先使用存储组件中最顶层的容器进行存储。可以通过单击并拖动列表中的存储显示来更改顺序

column2: 管理库存并允许将存储链接到其他对象。
在贸易中蓬勃发展的经济，对于开发制止流星所需的技术至关重要。

银行帐户是一个或多个公民可以访问的[Currency]的存储。每个公民都使用永久的个人银行帐户进入世界，其中包含无限量的个人信用。可以授予其他银行帐户，并在[Bank | bank组件]调整其访问权限。银行帐户对于组织货币，允许多方访问资金，存储税收的收集并指定谁可以使用它们非常有用。游戏俱乐部通常会设置一些银行帐户来管理税收流入，以确保资金按计划使用。每个银行帐户可以容纳无限数量的不限货币，每种货币分别进行跟踪。单击银行帐户将显示分类帐，其中列出了与之进行的所有交易或从中进行的所有交易，因为Eco中的所有交易都是公开的
银行账户用作货币的存储和分离，以供各种公民和游戏俱乐部实体使用。

column1: 合同是在[合同委员会|合同委员会组成部分]创建的两个公民之间的协议。该协议可以包含任意数量的条款，并指定要执行的工作和要支付的赔偿的组合。它由客户公民发布，并且可以被任何有效公民异步接受。

column2: 合同示例包括：-在两个指定点之间创建一条道路。 -在给定的利率和到期日之间，两方之间的贷款。 -在特定位置建立具有给定要求的房间。 -文字中描述的自定义要求，并在完成后被客户接受/拒绝
合同维持两个公民之间的协议。

column1: 手工制作是指通过成分，人工和/或力量来创造新产品。手工制作还会产生副产物，这些副产物会造成污染并对环境造成负面影响。它构成了经济的中坚力量，产生了对来自其周围生态系统的资源的需求，以及对个体熟练劳动力和共享服务（如[Power | Power Component]或[Sewage]）的需求。任何具有[工艺组件]的表都可以创建列表中定义的产品。工艺表可以共享，每个表都具有可配置的[Authorization Component]，该功能决定谁可以访问它们，并且可以在表的[Credit Component]中设置费用，以通过共享表赚钱。输入和输出既可以直接从制作台上获取，也可以放置在附加的[Storage Component]中。将配料和产品放入仓库后，市民可以排队自动运行的大订单。许多食谱都需要特定的[Skill |技能概述]。虽然任何公民都可以开始手工制作食谱或贡献食材，但只有具有所需技能的公民才可以增加劳动。为了组成一个团体并让许多公民在分担付款时为工作单供款，可以创建[工作组]

column2: 手工制作是公民在特定餐桌上创造的产品。

货币是促进贸易的一种手段，是价值的代表。它们的价值完全取决于它们的使用方式。 Eco中有两种类型的货币，有支持的和无支持的。无抵押货币是法定货币，每个玩家都以自己的无限数量的个人货币开始。这些在没有指定全球货币的情况下特别有用。但是，这些货币需要很多信任，即它们的所有者不会操纵其价值，因为它们的数量不受限制，并且很容易破坏使用它们的经济的稳定。支持的货币更加稳定。通过将货币支持材料转换为硬币，可以在[Mint | Mint Component]中创建支持的货币。只能通过获取更多给定材料来创建更多货币。这对可以引入世界的货币数量提供了更大的限制，并为全球贸易奠定了更坚实的基础。通常，随着经济在整个游戏过程中的发展，世界将选择从一系列个人货币过渡到一种或多种支持货币，并且需要更多的全球贸易与合作。可以在“经济查看器”中以及通过[Trade]将货币转移给其他人。所有货币都存储在[银行帐户|银行帐户]中
货币是使贸易更容易的社会结构。

Economy Concepts

column1: -[Crafting]。使用工业工具创造新产品。 -[Trade]。交换具有不同专业的个人创造的商品或获得资源。 -[Transport]。将资源从一个地方移到另一个地方，并在全球范围内建立基础设施。 -[Research]。促进人类知识以改善社会。 -[Currency]。公民创造的促进经济活动的价值的代表。 -[Work Parties]。有组织的劳工团体分享奖励。 -[Contracts]。两名公民之间关于劳动或其他安排的协议。 -[Bank Accounts]。具有可配置访问权限的货币容器。 -[Finance]。向其他公民提供资金，以帮助他们进步，同时自己赚钱。

column2: 经济包括公民的所有资源使用，贸易和技术进步。

通过使用[Contracts]，Eco中的公民可以在两方之间创建贷款和债券协议，从而自动跟踪资金的利息支付和到期日。贷款和债券是新公民与拥有更多财富的长期公民合作的一种好方法，既可以使双方受益，也可以促进社会进步。如果公民借贷，则供款方会给他们钱，并期望他们支付利息。如果公民购买了债券，他们便向要约方支付钱款，并期望他们可以付息。可以使用[Laws]来构建对贷款违约的罚款，方法是关注“贷款/债券违约”触发器。然后可以采取行动，例如收回财产或施加其他处罚和罚款
金融是管理货币以促进进步。
每个参与者都可以影响任何其他参与者的声望，而后者又可以用作章程，合同等中的因素，可以查询公民声望并根据价值确定特权（或特权）（或特权）。要设置公民的声望，请将鼠标悬停在其姓名上，然后在工具提示中单击其声望列表（可在[Current Citizens]页面上找到所有公民的列表）
声望由网络乘数修改，网络乘数的计算方式是：给每个给您正面声望的公民+1，给每个给您负面声望的公民-1。这样，与只关注少数几个公民相比，帮助许多公民并获得广泛的声望变得更加有益。相对声望是另一个价值，它仅考虑您对自己给予正面声望的公民。
由其他公民或代表您社会地位的章程而设定的一个值。

研究创造了可共享的新知识，从而释放了新类型的产品和能力。它是在您制作技能手册的[ResearchTableItem] 上进行的。创建后，技能书可用于创建无限数量的技能卷轴，这将为使用该技能卷轴的公民解锁专业知识。每个技能卷轴都是一次性使用的消耗品，可在使用它的任何人中解锁新的[Specialty|specialties]，然后必须通过[Skills|skills overview] 系统进行升级以声明其权利。获得新的技能卷轴还会使公民受益于一套[Property Claim Papers|Property]，这使他们可以在获得技能时索取更多土地。技能书是最难创建的一些内容，市民通常需要协作以获取制作它们所需的所有各种资源和劳动力。因此，研究项目特别适合[Work Parties]，因为公民可以使用它们来共享创建它们所需的工作以及完成时的知识奖励。
研究创造了可共享的新知识，释放了新类型的产品和能力。

与您的同胞进行交易在Eco中至关重要，因为每个玩家都有一套[Specialties]，他们可以在与其他擅长职业的其他公民进行交易时最有效地做出贡献。 -可以在[Store Component] 设置交易，列出您想要的不同商品的买/卖价格。然后，公民可以在不存在的情况下异步地向您购买和出售商品。 -劳务交易可以通过[Contracts] 和[Work Parties] 进行，允许玩家在商定的条件下进行付款工作。这也可以异步执行。 -货币交易可以在[Currency Exchange|Exchange Component] 进行，其中列出了不同货币交换的买/卖价格。 -[Transport] 促进了贸易，在您的新兴文明中心之间建立运输基础设施将极大地提高贸易能力。 -贸易受游戏俱乐部[government overview] 设定的[Taxes] 的约束，这可以促进或减少某些贸易的价值。
具有不同能力和拥有不同商品的公民之间的贸易是经济的支柱。

随着资源分布在世界各地以及资源的收集和加工地点与使用地点不同，运输已成为生态成功的关键因素。为了有效地转换材质，您需要制造车辆来运送它们，而这些车辆需要将地面压平成道路。使用[StoneRoadToolItem] 可以平整地面并使其可用于车辆，而使用坡道则可以使车辆可以平缓行驶。更高阶的车辆将要求先进的道路有效行驶，并且随着新技术的出现，道路需要定期进行升级。在村庄之间建立道路和资源储备库将花费时间和许多公民的精力，并且是[Taxes] 资助并使用[Work Parties] 进行的公共工程项目的理想选择。随着世界技术的进步，将创建越来越多的运输基础设施来辅助商业流通，最终发展到道路建设和车辆使用会对环境产生影响的地步。认真管理这种影响将是保护它们所通过的生态系统的关键。
随着资源及其使用遍及全球，通过建设交通基础设施来改变世界变得必要。

工作小组是多个公民之间执行工作的协议。创建工作订单后，他们可以通过访问[Contract Board|Contract Board Component] 由个人公民启动。发布工作组的公民可以定义工作的各种参数，包括：-要完成的工作单。 -想要加入工作组的公民需要什么。 -将向参加活动的人支付什么费用。 -付款将如何分配。 -付款将如何分配。工作组对于执行[Research] 尤其有用。公民可以建立一个研究项目，花费大量资源，并为其配备一个工作小组。然后，公民可以自动加入工作组（即使发行公民是脱机的，如果他们满足指定的要求），也可以开始执行任务。付款可以采用多种形式：-[Currency]，根据立即执行或完成时执行的工作量进行分配。 -[Reputation]，由工作组创建者提供给劳动者（取决于每天可享有的声望限制）。 -特定专业的知识（与阅读技能卷的效果相同）。为此，工作团队的创建者必须拥有该专业的技能手册，或者必须在该团队的工作订单之一中制作。 -授予[Title]，这可以赋予他们访问属性和其他能力的新特权。生态经济不仅关注商品贸易，还关注劳动力贸易，而工作团体使向普通民众提供多种工作变得容易。
工作组是许多参与者共同执行特定任务的共同协议，并以各种方式分配报酬。
世界上的生物群落，提供人类赖以生存的资源。

column1: 地球上巨大的生物多样性和丰富性可以大致归类为生物群落。生态中的生物群落是世界上属于降水和温度特定范围的区域。由于这些模拟的物理差异，不同种类的微生物，植物，真菌和动物能够在不同的生物群落中生存和繁衍。 Eco中的每个生物群落都拥有一套独特的资源，供玩家发现和提取，以建立并促进他们的社会。每个生物群落内的生活社区之间通常都有相互依存的关系，而这些相互联系是与栖息地，饮食和土壤联系在一起的，而这些联系又由于存在的气候和地球资源而产生。生物群落是全球生态系统内的生态系统，有时在生物群落内还有进一步的划分或“亚生物群落”，例如高沙漠，高草草原，冻原上的冰川冰层或海洋海岸。生物群落和亚生物群落是连续的单元，其中许多单元对它们可以位于附近或内部的生物群落有限制。随着时间的流逝，由于玩家的影响而导致的环境变化，生物群落有可能被彻底重塑。气候变化可能会改变生物群落的边界，使社区流离失所-一些物种将生存和适应，而另一些物种则不会如此灵活。建筑，耕作，采矿和伐木等活动对土壤的直接置换和其他栖息地破坏也将对生物群落内的物种产生不同程度的影响。动植物物种不仅可能喜欢特定的生物群落，而且更喜欢亚生物群落的某些部分，如果这些高度局部的地区被改变或破坏，这将意味着更大的影响。弹性和适应性物种将能够随着其改变而跨越生物群落边界，但是这些相同的物种可能会在引入它们的新生物群落中成为对更敏感的动植物的威胁。

column2: Eco中的生物群落:

海洋：大陆架上的海洋部分，充满生命。深海：海洋中最深的部分，拥有最大的海洋物种和鱼类迁徙种群。冷海岸：较冷气候下的海滩和浅水区。温暖的海岸：温暖气候下的海滩和浅水区。湿地：一种独特的生物群落，其特征是土壤被淡水或微咸水浸透。草原：一个生物群落，那里有足够的水来支撑草，但树木不多。沙漠：最干燥的生物群落，而在Eco中，目前也是最热的。寒冷的森林：足够湿润以支撑茂密的树木覆盖物的生物群落，而寒冷的足以使针叶树占主导地位。温暖的森林：一个生物群落，足够湿润以支撑茂密的树木，并足够温暖，以致阔叶树占主导地位。雨林：一种湿热的生物群落，为拥有丰富动植物生命的森林提供支持。针叶林：一种寒冷且有些干燥的生物群落，支撑着针叶树的稀疏森林。苔原：一个非常寒冷的生物群落，不能支撑树木，但拥有独特的动植物群落。冰：该国最寒冷的地区，被冰川冰覆盖。当前，Eco中还存在一些亚生物群系：高沙漠：沙漠中的地质抬升部分，其物种更能耐寒冷，并享有由侵蚀引起的陡峭悬崖。寒冷草原：草原略冷，通常以更少的树木和更大的开放空间为特征。
动植物的生存系统为人类的生存提供了手段。
Graphs

column1: 每个Eco世界都存储游戏中的每个动作，并监视模拟各个方面的进度。数据存储在几个主要类别中，特别是生态系统和经济。随着参与者的行动或生态系统的变化，它将以对市民可见的图形表示。图形对于比较各种指标的状态并随时间查看它们最有用。因此，通过研究事物在实施之后的变化，它们对于回顾章程和法规的结果特别有用。它们还有助于推断未来的影响，预测事物变化的速度（即因森林砍伐而导致的人口减少）并在变化发生之前进行更改。阅读，撰写和理解图表对于游戏俱乐部来说是一个非常强大的工具，为公民提供了制作图表的工具，这些图表可以支持或反驳论点，并在讨论公民行为时直接将其呈现给同胞。

column2: 热图

column1: Eco世界的地方千差万别，有许多不同的生物群落和人类发展及环境影响的位置。要查看世界各地的变化情况，可为游戏中的所有各种世界特效提供热图。可以通过热图查看诸如公民活动，人口比率，污染率，温度，湿度等数十种值，并记录随时间变化的变化，可以回放并用于科学论证。玩家可以通过两种方式查看这些内容：通过游戏中的小地图，还可以在游戏中显示彩色地形。其次，可以在网络浏览器中查看它们，并利用其随时间回放的能力。每10分钟（可配置）将每个热图的快照存储在服务器数据中，市民可以查看热图随时间变化的时间推移视图。这对于衡量特定位置的影响并确定构建基础结构和新闻解决方案的最佳途径至关重要。

column2: 小地图

column1: 迷你地图是游戏中功能强大的工具，可用于许多目的：导航，计划，数据查看，属性定位等。可以启用它来查看游戏的各个世界层（热图），并使用渐变色突出显示人口高/低，污染，公民活动等高/低的区域。可以手动添加标记，也可以在全球范围内为所有公民添加标记，以指向特定地点，以帮助协调人类活动。这些标记还用于自动引导市民从事动态工作，指定在合同中应在何处修建道路，在何处运送货物以进行运输等。目前，我们正在努力在游戏中添加对财产和地区的指定，并为工作方和合同指定特定的土地区域，例如允许公民在游戏中突出显示他们希望雇用其他人耕种的区域，或修建道路等。这将极大地开放劳动力市场的能力，使公民在指定他们希望工作的地点时以更轻松的方式更加明确。

column1: 生态系统本身就是生态系统的终结，它的持续繁荣是游戏的主要目标，同时也伴随着经济发展。也就是说，生态系统始于胜利状态，玩家必须使用其资源而不会使其陷入失败状态，这将意味着对人类的破坏。无论服务器是否在游戏中，Eco中的生态系统都在连续模拟中运行，只要服务器在运行，它就一直处于活动状态。每个模拟的动植物都在生长，消耗食物并繁殖。它是玩家必须建立自己的社会的唯一材料来源，而提取它们的过程将对其产生极大的影响。砍伐森林可能会破坏生物的栖息地，使它们灭绝。矿山尾矿可能污染附近的河流和湖泊，使依赖它的农场中毒。玩家在“生态”游戏中采取的行动会影响他们的环境，玩家需要了解他们所拥有的影响才能蓬勃发展并阻止流星。不能将生态系统保持在原始，未受破坏的状态。流星确保选择也将导致生态系统的破坏。为了保护它，公民必须从中受益，建立一个有权制止流星的社会，同时也要有制止其在此过程中不破坏生态系统的约束力。

column2: 游戏玩法

生态系统是公民必须理解和抗衡的基础系统。从不断发展的[Farms|Farming] 和[Mines|Mining] 到通过研究了解[Pollution] 的影响，公民对生态系统的影响将决定玩家决策的成败。借助游戏中的[Data] 了解其功能将成为生存的关键条件。与[Economy|Economy Overview] 和[Government|Government Overview] 不同，该生态系统不是公民构建的系统–它的行为是绝对的，其运行方式无法通过经济方式改变而改变。从这个意义上讲，这是一个现实检查，在这里，公民的偏见和信念发生冲突，并揭示出真正的后果。
在经济与游戏俱乐部之间
随着公民社会进步，他们必须提防“公地悲剧”。赋予人们不受限制地使用共同资源的机会，经常会导致其遭到破坏。为了避免这种情况，公民必须组织起来，通过[Laws] 和其他公民法规来决定共同利益的规则，这些规则可能会限制个人，但允许团体生存。个人与群体之间的冲突构成了建设文明挑战的核心。

column1: 农业提供了一种方法，可以将对人类最有用的植物品种带入全球，并提供全球范围的粮食供应。农业也可以集中在对其他工业用途有用的植物上，例如用作潜在可再生能源的生物燃料。农民将需要注意其土壤的资源和健康，避免消耗和污染。像[CompostFertilizerItem] 这样的肥料和像[SoilSamplerItem] 这样的监测土壤资源的方法将是保持农田生产力的重要工具。随着社会对食物和燃料需求的增加，各种车辆，存储技术和更强大的手动工具将使玩家能够扩大他们的农业活动。农业是生态中的一项重要活动，我们希望在发展中不断发展壮大。平衡和存储将是开始进行农业改良的核心部分，因为我们确保生态社会能为农民带来适当的需求以推动技术发展，并确保存在存储对象和机械来满足这些需求。农业本身有许多可能的改进和扩展，其中包括发展和改良种子和生物，使其更具生产性或对污染物或其他环境因素产生抵抗力。

column1: 生态土壤含有能够使植物生长和繁衍的营养素：任何给定类型的过多或过少都会改变天然植物和农场植物的产量和生长速度。随着植物的生长，它们从土壤中吸收养分，死后将其返回，使世界进入自然平衡状态。玩家通过收割，砍伐森林，采矿或引入污染从土壤中去除养分的方式将植物从环境中清除，从而影响这些变化。玩家可以在自己的土地上使用肥料重新引入养分或修改现有比例。随着我们增加动物对植物层的依赖性，我们可以使生态系统的那些部分进一步影响土壤，因为食用植物的物种也可以从土壤中去除养分。另一个可以考虑的问题是表层土壤在Eco中的存在方式：目前，表层土壤是纯粹的化妆品，并与该地区的生物群落相关，但是与下面的致密粘土和污垢相比，在每个生物群落中，表层土壤都是一种独特而宝贵的资源。

column2: 手工开采

column1: To mine ore, first you must locate it. Ores in Eco are each hosted in particular host rocks, so learning which rocks have the type of ore you want and then digging near rocks of those type is a good way to start. Use a [WoodenShovelItem] or better to dig away soil from the surface or start digging into a hill from the side. Once you hit rock you want to go through, you'll need to use a pickaxe like the [StonePickaxeItem] to break it. When breaking rocks with the pickaxe, sometimes you'll break off a larger piece of rock that needs to be hit again to break into pieces small enough to pick up. It's a good idea to pick up rock as you break it, and stack it elsewhere for use, preferably in a [StockpileItem] or vehicle you're using to transport your ore like a [WoodCartItem].

column2: Mineral Processing

column1: Once you have collected a large amount of metal ore, you'll need to process the ore before you can craft metal products with it. This is a dirty and expensive process, and optimizing it and the byproducts from it will be an ongoing matter of consideration. The three main steps of mineral processing are:
Comminution: Comminution means to crush the rock into smaller sized particles which can be further processed. Crushed rock of the type the ore is hosted in is the main byproduct of this process.

Concentration: Concentration is a way to separate the desired metals in an ore rock from the waste rock. This process is never perfect, and inevitably results in a large output of waste rock which still contains traces of freed metals. This waste rock with traces of heavy metals is known as [TailingsItem]. [CopperOreItem] and [GoldOreItem] require chemical leeching and wet processing to separate from their host rocks, and thus produce more polluted and volatile [WetTailingsItem] during the concentration process.
Smelting: Once you have precious ore concentrate, you can at last smelt it into metal products like [IronBarItem] at a [BloomeryItem] or using a more advanced smelting technology.

column1: As citizens burn fuel to cook or generate power, smelt metals, process sewage, and engage in countless other necessary industrial activities, a common byproduct is pollution. Pollution is any substance that can act as a contaminant or poison when introduced back into the environment. In Eco there are many sources and several varieties of pollution, some of which are more potent than others. Heavy metals can contaminate soil, affecting available nutrients and the health of plants and animals living on and in it. Water can spread contaminants rapidly and increase the size of their impact. Air pollution can pour invisibly or obviously from a stove or a power plant, adding to greenhouse gasses and impacting the air quality, as well as fall back down into the ground as acid rain.

To ensure the survival of ecosystems and preserve resources like soil and water, players will have to manage and contain the sources of pollution their civilization creates. In some cases, spills or deadly concentrations will be inevitable, and then remediation and storage may be the only option to return the land to an unharmed state.

column2: 地面污染

column1: Once released into the soils and water table, ground pollutants are not easy to stop or remove. Various materials in Eco are sources of ground pollution, most notably tailings from mining and garbage from crafting and other player activities. Pollution spreads as a gradient that increases in concentration with time if the source of pollutants remains or increases. When the source of pollutants is removed from contact with the ground, ground pollution spreads and dissipates with time.

column2: Air Pollution

column1: Many player activities can create harmful emissions which if released into the atmosphere act as air pollution. Crafting at objects with CO2 outputs or running generators with them contributes to local and global pollution levels. Over long periods of time, global CO2 levels contributes to a global warming effect which affects sea level in turn. There are natural sinks and intakes for some pollutants like CO2 such as forests.
Concentrations of air pollution will fall back to the ground as acid rain, which we simulate using the air pollution and local rainfall quantities.

column2: Water Pollution

column1: Water is a medium through which pollution spreads more quickly and further, rushing downstream and blossoming out in lakes or oceans. Pollution in the water generally comes from nearby ground pollution sources, but also may be entering the water via the acid rain mechanic in areas with lots of air pollution.
Removal of the source is the only way to currently stop water pollution, but clean-up and remediation strategies are features we are considering for the future.

column2: Containment

column1: In many cases, there is no perfect solution to deal with polluting materials. Space must be made to store various pollutants, and pollutants must be stored in a way that prevents them from re-entering the surrounding environment. This is a challenge that should be key to environmental management of industry in Eco. Currently tailings mechanics require deep underground storage
column2: this will be improved with further development.

column1: Containment mechanics are the forefront of features we want to improve related to the Pollution group of features in Eco. Players should be using containment to deal with the vast quantities of tailings and garbage that their societies produce.

Consitutional Articles define how things happen in the government: who can pass laws, set taxes, change the rules, etc.  It can also define certain actions as needing an election, by specifying an [Election Process|Election Processes] inside them.

column1: Constitutional Articles can be added in two places.  On a [CapitolItem], you can add up to three, and on [AmendmentsItem] you can add up to another 10 more per item.

Defining the rules of the government is very important for keeping it a stable, society-supporting structure.  Governments can be granted a great deal of power over the world with laws, and there's a danger of this power being abused.  By setting a system of checks and balances, citizens can design a government that can undergo a number of changes, including changes of leadership, while maintaining the power to effect positive changes in the world.

column2: A set of rules about how the government works.
A constitution is a founding document defining how a society will be governed.  A constitution must be created before any other government object. They are created at a [Capitol|CapitolItem].

column1: Overthrowing Governments
Once a capitol is placed, a constitution can be ratified by opening it and clicking Ratify. As long as there are no other constitutions, the government will be immediately created.

If there is already a constitution active, a new constitution can only take its place if the housing value of its room exceeds the existing constitution by a significant amount, depending on the server settings.
Note: A forthcoming update of Eco will allow multiple concurrent governments.

column2: The founding document for a government.

column1: Demographics are classes of citizen, created in the government. These can then be used anywhere you can specify a citizen (permissions, laws, etc).

For example, citizens could define a demographic 'Lumberjacks', which would only contain users with a logging skill level of 3 or more.  Then, a law could be created that only permits 'Lumberjacks' to cut down old-growth trees.
Demographics are defined at a [Census Bureau|CensusBureauItem].
Demographics can also have wages set on them. Wages are paid periodically as long as a citizen remains within the demographic.

column2: Defines a set of citizens matchings some criteria.
Districts are created by players at a [ZoningOfficeItem] and can be used as areas that are specified by laws.

column1: A district is a selected area of land, non-contiguous, which players can adjust at will.  Districts are contained in District Maps, and there can be multiple district maps in the world. However, within each district map, no districts may overlap.
Districts can be used to designate where actions are allowed with laws. A law can be created, for example, that prevents creating chopping trees in a 'Protected Zone' district.

column2: A defined section of land, which can be referenced by laws and other systems.
Elected Titles are government officials that can be assigned permissions to manage government policy. These titles can be used anywhere you can specify a citizen (permissions, laws, etc.).

column1: Elected titles are created at a [GovernmentOfficeItem]. Several conditions can be set when defining an elected title:
- An [Election Process|Election Processes] with term limits for title holders
- The number of citizens who can hold the elected title at the same time
- Requirements to stay in office once elected to the title
- A successor who takes over the position if a title holder is removed from office
While creating an elected title, the following permissions can be assigned:
- Setting the tax rate at a [TreasuryItem]
- Access to spend the funds in the Treasury bank account
- Government banking privileges to create government bank accounts that are exempt from personal wealth calculations
- The ability to place a global map marker to notify citizens of a point of interest
Elected titles can be assigned wages that are paid periodically to the citizens that hold the title.

column2: Elected Titles are government officials that can be assigned permissions to manage government policy.
Citizens can define new types of elections at a [BoardOfElectionsItem], and each election process created there can be used for various changes to government and leadership.

column1: [Civic Articles] can reference Election Processes in order to designate actions that require an election.  [Elected Titles] created at a [GovernmentOfficeItem] must specify an Election Process by which new members get elected.

Each Election Process can define a different set of voters, vetoers, timings, percent needed to win, etc.  Using different types of elections, citizens can design their government to have different seats of power. For example, they can define a powerful Title that must be elected by the general population but can be impeached by them as well.

column2: Defines how an election takes place.
Elections can take two forms:

column1: - Elections of Officials . These are elections of [Elected Titles] which give specific powers to a citizen.
- Referendums.  A yes-or-no vote that will determine if a specific civic action should be taken.
Elections are started at a [BallotBoxItem], where citizens can perform a number of civic actions.  Depending on what [Civic Articles] are available, these actions may or may not require an election
column2: if they do, the citizen will have the option to start one immediately.

column1: Elections can have a number of settings determined by their [Election Process|Election Processes]. This will state who can vote, who can veto, how long the election lasts, what percent is needed to win, etc.  Multiple types of elections can be created for different purposes. For example, a representative government could be created with some elections only allowing elected officials to vote, while most citizens vote only in elections for representatives.

column2: A poll set to a group of citizens to determine a position or referendum.
Executive Actions are one-time actions that can affect a specific group of citizens or all citizens at once.

column1: Executive Actions can be proposed at an [ExecutiveOfficeItem] using the [Civic Action Component]. These actions have three main effects:
- Issue a one-time [Tax|Taxes]
- Provide a payment to citizens from the [TreasuryItem]
- Change the [Property] owner of existing property
Depending on what [Civic Articles] are available, these actions may or may not require an election. Some civic articles state that only [Elected Titles] may perform Executive Actions.

column2: An action performed by a government official having effects on taxes, property, etc.

Between the ecosystem and the economy lies the government, run by citizens to ensure the survival and thriving of both.

column1: The government is created by citizens, piece by piece, growing their power and capability alongside the power of the populace.  The parts of the government are:

column2: [Constitution]

column1: Before any other aspect of government can be created, a Constitution must be created at a [CapitolItem]. It determines the how the government operates via civic articles.

column2: [Civic Articles]

column1: A constitution contains civic articles which define how the government functions: who can do what, and how.  They can be created at a [CapitolItem] on a new constitution or added to an existing constitution at an [AmendmentsItem] table.

column2: [Laws]

column1: Laws determine rules and processes that all citizens are compelled to follow.  A [CourtItem] can hold up to 3 laws.

column2: [Elections]

column1: Elections will be started automatically when making changes that require them, as determined by the constitution. They can have many effects (changing laws, electing leaders, performing executive actions).

column2: [Election Processes]

column1: An election process determines how elections work: who can vote and veto, how long they last, what majorities are required, etc. A [BoardOfElectionsItem] can hold up to three election processes.

column2: [Elected Titles]

column1: An Elected Title is a government position that can be given special privileges. A [GovernmentOfficeItem] can hold one elected title.

column2: [Demographics]

column1: A demographic defines a group of people according to specific rules. This group can then be used in other aspects of the government.  A [CensusBureauItem] can hold up to three demographics.

column2: [Districts]

column1: Defines an area of land which can be referenced in laws and other places.  A [ZoningOfficeItem] can hold up to three district maps.

column2: [Executive Actions]

column1: An executive action is a one-time operation that can be performed to enact changes to society. They are performed at an [ExecutiveOfficeItem] by users given privileges from the constitution (typically elected titles).
[Ballot Boxes|Civic Action Component]
A ballot box allows operations to be performed related to elections and holding office.
[Treasury|Treasury Component]
Determines taxes on various parts of the economy.

column2: An institution designed and run by the people to promote the common good.
Laws are the means by which the government makes changes in the world, to achieve goals of the populace.

column1: Laws are created by placing a [CourtItem], and depending on the [Civic Articles] available may require an election to pass.  Each law is created with a list of causes and effects, and when the cause happens the effect will be activated.  This allows a lot of flexibility in how the laws work, and they can cover many areas
column2: from taxation to regulation to paid out funds incentivizing activities.

column1: Many ‘Cause’ choices will provide context about the citizen who triggered it, where it was triggered, etc. These ‘context’ properties can be seen in the Cause tooltip, and are available for specifying data in the ‘Effects’.  For example, an effect may tax the specific player who chopped down a tree

column2: Cause-and-Effect rules designed by citizens and enforced automatically in order to achieve societal goals.
For the good of the people, or at least the enrichment of the government, taxes can be levied on many actions in Eco.

column1: Treasury Taxes
At a [TreasuryItem], Taxes can be set on a variety of actions:
- Sales Tax.  Tax applied to the sale of goods at a store.
- Crafting Fee Tax. Tax applied to the fees taken from sharing your crafting station.
- Contract Tax. Taxes taken from payments made through contracts and work parties.
- Direct Transfer Tax. Taxes taken from transfers between players.
- Self Direct Transfer Tax. Taxes taken when transferring to an account you have access to (to optionally protect against tax avoidance loopholes).

Only a citizen holding an [Elected Title|Elected Titles] who has been granted the right to ‘Set Taxes at the Treasury’ may adjust these rates.  All taxes taken from these settings will be stored in the special ‘Treasury’ bank account.  Allocation may be made out of this special bank account into others through commands on the treasury.
Law Taxes

Taxes can also be set through [Laws], which can have their amounts and destinations determined dynamically. The bank account they are placed in can also be determined, allowing for the funding of specific funds for specific purposes, stored in bank accounts accessible to a limited number of people only.  Using the law system, these taxes can be very specifically targeted and adjusted based on the actions that are happening.

For example, a 'Minister of Transportation' Elected Title position could be created, having sole access to a Transportation Fund [Bank Account|Bank Accounts].  A law could then be created to tax the production and trade of fuel, with proceeds going into the Transportation Fund, where the currently elected Minister of Transportation can use them to fund new roadbuilding [Work Parties].

column2: Tax can be taken from the economy to fund publics works project as well as incentivize or disincentivize economic activity.

Titles are used for designating a group of users, then referencing that group in other things like permissions.  They are different from [Demographics] in that Titles are specified directly by citizens, while the citizens within a demographic are automatically defined based on a citizen-defined condition.

column1: There are two types of Titles available:
- Regular Titles. These can be created and managed by anyone at a [RegistrarItem].  There, the citizen can set which other citizens can assign the role (managers) and which are occupying the role.

- Elected Titles. These titles can only be elected (or appointed) and are created at a [GovernmentOfficeItem].  The properties of the government office determine what kind of [Election] is needed to elect the given position.  Elected Titles can only be left if they are forcibly removed from office, if they resign (both performed at a [BallotBoxItem], or if their term ends as defined in the position’s term limits.

Elected Titles give a lot of flexibility in defining the governance of a world, and privileges can be tied directly to these accounts. For example, a tax law could be created that taxes vehicle usage and puts it into a fund that only the Elected Title ‘Minister of Transportation’ has access to. If there is another election for that position and it changes leaders, then the former citizen will automatically lose access to the account.

By setting requirements on the Elected Title, you can ensure the continued good governance by citizens holding office. For example, you could place a requirement that all occupants of a given office are part of the 'Active' demographic may hold it. If an office holder becomes inactive, they will then automatically be removed from office and a specified successor put in their position.
Titles can also have wages set on them. Wages are paid periodically as long as a citizen continues to occupy the title (and the payer has funds).

column2: Positions which can hold one or more citizens.  Used for designating permissions and paying wages.

A citizen cannot thrive without proper shelter, and together with your [Nutrition] your Housing value will determine your [Experience] multiplier.  The better your house’s materials and furnishing are, the higher your experience multiplier.

column1: Additionally, many objects require houses and utilities to operate. The housing system consists of the following parts:
- [Rooms]. A room is a fully contained space, and many objects require being place inside a room to function.
- [Property]. Citizens can claim individual plots of land which they then can control access to.
- [Power]. Many items require a power source to operate, and generated power can be shared among many citizens.
- [Sewage]. Certain items require a sewage system of pipes, pumps, and wastewater treatment.

column2: Your housing (along with your diet) determines your skill gain.
Many objects require power to function, and as your society progresses the types of power will progress as well.

column1: Early on, most power will come from calories expended by citizens.  Local-power sources can also be built such as [Waterwheels|Waterwheel Item], powering only the immediate vicinity.  When technology progresses to electricity, power can then be generated centrally, allowing groups to form together to power towns and cities as a group rather than having to individually setup power sources (community projects like this are a great fit for using the [Taxes] system to fund them, and [Contracts] and [Work Parties] to get them built).

Many types of power generation exist, and each has different fuel needs as well as environmental impact.  The building, fueling, and operation of power plants can become a major [Pollution] source as technology advances, and citizens will need to carefully regulate the types of power used and how pollution is handled to prevent an ecological catastrophe.

column2: Many objects require power to function, which can be generated in a variety of ways.

column1: By claiming Property, citizens can protect access to plots of land, determining who is allowed to access the land and what they are allowed to do on objects contained on it.

column2: Land Property Rights

column1: Land can be claimed as property by using a [Land Claim Stake|Property Tool Item] and targeting an unclaimed plot of land.  When targeted, a [Land Claim Paper|Property Claim Item] will be consumed, and the citizen will become the owner on the deed. The property at your current position can be seen in the world panel in the bottom right of the screen, and clicking the title will open the deed.

column2: Object Property Rights

Objects can have their access rights set separately from the land they are on, to allow consumer access to objects that are on private land.  These settings are determined in an [Authorization Component].
凭证

On the deed, citizens can add and remove parties that may access the land (place or remove blocks).  The owner can also be changed by clicking the gear beside the owner name.  Note that both [Demographics] and [Titles] can both be given ownership on a deed, including [Elected Titles]. Structuring a government this way can allow only elected officials to have certain access rights to land.
Citizens and governments may own property and determine the access rights of them.
Rooms are enclosed areas protected from the elements where all holes to the outside world are filled with walls, doors and windows.

column1: You can see the details about a room in a panel on the right side of the screen while you’re inside one stating its information. Many types of objects have Room Requirements and will take up space in their room, and require the materials of the room to be a specific quality.  Your housing value is also affected by the quality of the room materials.  This means a brick a house for example will provide much more benefit than a dirt hovel.
Furnishings and Room Types

By claiming land and building rooms on it, you will begin to gain additional experience, which persists even when offline.  Adding additional types of rooms and furnishings for those rooms will increase it further.  Each type of furniture is associated with a kind of room: Bathroom, Bedroom, Kitchen, or General (displayed on the tooltip of the item).  The room type will be determined by whichever category you have the highest contribution of furnishings from.  Each room will have its value calculated by summing all the furnishings inside it.
Repeats of the same furniture inside a room or repeats of the same room type in a house will give you diminishing returns
column2: that is, you will still get housing points for them, but not as many as the first.   Eventually the point gain will be negligible, and it won’t be worth it to add any more of that type of furniture or room to the house.  For example, your 12th bathroom is going to add much less value to your house than your first one.

column1: Room Material Quality

The average tier of the room material will also determine your housing value, by setting a soft cap.  Once your room value has exceeded the soft cap for the room, then you will get diminishing returns for additional housing points.  When this happens, it may be time to renovate the materials of the room.

column2: Rooms protect you and your equipment from the elements, providing skill points and allowing equipment to function.

column1: Many industrial and housing objects require sewage support to function.  Typically, this means requiring water as an input, and an output for waste water.  Every object that has a [Pipe Component] will need a sewage connection.

Sewage systems are created by connecting a [MechanicalWaterPumpItem] or [ElectricWaterPumpItem] to a water source, and then building Pipes between the different objects that need supplying.  On the waste side, pipes will take the waste water from the object to either dump it into the environment (producing [Pollution] at the exit point), or process it at a [Waster Filter|WasteFilterItem], which will generate [Compost|CompostItem] from the wastewater.
Pipes will automatically connect to any adjacent pipe block of the same type.  To make sewage systems with different pipes in close proximity, use different materials of pipes.

As you gain experience in Eco you will be able to unlock new specialties and new abilities within those specialties. There are two types of experience you will gain, Character Experience and Specialty Experience.  Both are increased by your Experience Multiplier.

column1: Character Experience

Character Experience is your background learning rate, how fast you are gaining knowledge and abilities.  It is constantly going up, even when you’re offline.  Each real-day, you will gain Character Experience at the rate of 1 * your experience multiplier.  When you reach a level up, you will gain a new specialty unlock, represented by a star.  Each level up will require more and more character experience to gain, so it is very difficult to have more than a few specialties.
Specialty Experience

Specialty Experience is your skill at a specific ability, and rather than going up constantly, it only goes up when you perform actions related to that specialty, such as crafting or performing labor.  Like Character Experience, it too is multiplied by you Experience Multiplier. Along the left side of the screen, you’ll see icons displaying how much experience you’re gaining when you perform actions, and you can click these to get a closer look at the level ups for that specialty.
Some level ups will allow you to unlock talents, which give specific bonuses related to the skills they’re in.
Experience Multiplier

Your Experience Multiplier (or XP Multiplier) is a personal value representing your health and support system, and it determines how fast you learn new skills.  It is determined as a sum of your [Nutrition] and [Housing|Housing Overview] values.  Because it affects both your character and specialty experience points, you’ll want to keep it as high as possible by eating the nutritious food and having a well-furnished house.

column2: There are two kinds of experience in Eco: Character Experience (gained by food and housing) and Specialty Experience (gained by performing actions in a specialty).

column1: Your Experience[Experience] is determined by your nutrition and housing[Housing|Housing Overview], and the more nutritious the food you eat the faster you will gain [Experience].  The healthier you are, the faster you advance.

There are four nutrients represented in foods: Protein, Fat, Vitamins, and Carbs.  By adding up the average of each of these nutrients in all the food you’ve eaten in the last 24 hours, your experience multiplier is determined.   This means that if you eat junk food (low nutrients) it will affect you for 24 hours before it has passed through your body.

Additionally, a balance multiplier is applied, giving an additional 0% - 50% of your total based on how equal the nutrients are in your body. If you have exactly 25% of each nutrient for example, you will gain an extra 50% skill.
Depending on the difficulty settings for this server, a ‘skill gain multiplier’ may also be set which increases it further.

Finally, a base skill gain value is added to the total. This ensures that even when you’re totally starving, you’re still gaining at least some skill.  You can see all these calculations for yourself in the tooltip for food in the bottom left UI.
Calories

Calories, unlike nutrients, are spent when you perform work, and when you run out of calories you’ll be unable to work until you eat more.  Calorie usage can be greatly reduced by upgraded tools and leveling-up skills.
All food provides both calories and nutrients, so while gaining calories from food you’re also determining your skill multiplier, so watch that diet.

column2: Nutrition, alongside housing, determines how fast you gain experience.

Professions and Specialties
[Professions|Profession Overview] are simply groupings of skills, and don’t serve any other purpose besides storing similar skills together.
Specialties are each contained under a profession and require two steps to gain.
1. First, you must read a skill scroll for the skill.
2. Next, you must spend a star to take the specialty.

Once you have chosen the specialty, you gain the base-level abilities associated with it. As you perform actions related to that specialty, you will gain Specialty [Experience], leveling up the specialty and unlocking new abilities to it.

You can see the spread of specialties that other citizens have chosen on the skill selection dialog, and it is often a good idea to choose specialties that other players have not chosen or leveled up. This will allow you to each perform your own specialties and [Trade] with each other for a net gain.

column1: Animal species are inhabitants of the world in Eco that vary greatly in terms of possible use as resources. Some species make for excellent sources of meat and food like milk, where others may provide useful byproducts like wool, leather, tallow, or bone meal. But animals also vary greatly in terms of their resilience and adaptability to impacts on their populations, habitat, and food sources.

Through hunting, players can use various traps and hand tools to harvest wild animals directly from the ecosystems they live in for use. Hunting can also serve as a way to control or cull excessive populations of animals. Hunting will be an important but not strictly necessary activity for players especially earlier on in order to meet the appetite of a large society.

Hunting an animal is only the first step in making the most use out of it. Butchery advancements will allow players to process and use animals for a large variety of animal products. Collaboration with other professions like cooks and tailors will unlock many nutritional, industrial, and even cultural uses for animals and their products, not all of which need be obtained through hunting. However, if a particular animal product becomes popular in the economy, care will have to be taken to avoid destructive pressure on a species. Hunting is often the final blow to an endangered species whose products become more and more valuable as they become more and more rare.

To get started with hunting, you'll need to craft a [WoodenBowItem] and some [Arrows|Arrow Item]. More advanced bows will make it easier to hit your target quickly. Keep in mind that animals can be killed more quickly with a well-aimed shot, and that it may be easier to hunt some animals based on the time of day.

column1: The [Government|Government Overview] of Eco is run by individual citizens, and the quality of governance is fully dependent on how those citizens participate.

Using this currency to purchase the goods and services of others will then allow you to reach those goals without having to learn everything yourself.

As you build up your capabilities and have more needs of other citizens, you can create your own stores, contracts, and work parties to seek their aid.  As you acquire wealth, your power to effect change (both good and bad) rises.

Proximity to Resources

column1: Natural food sources and building supplies nearby will greatly speed up initial progress.
Proximity to Others

Property you claim will be protected from other citizens, unless you give them access.
食物

Additionally, the [Nutrition] of the food you eat impacts how fast you gain experience, so you'll want to eat the best food available for the fastest gains.  When settling in the wilderness, look for food sources nearby you can take from, or plan to setup a [Farm|Farming]. column1: Eco is a world bookended by two threats: Environmental collapse, and the ever-looming [Meteor|The Meteor].

To succeed, you'll need to progress through the ages, advancing science and industry to a level that can destroy the meteor without causing ecological collapse in the process.  You will do this as individual member of a larger society, and the creating a positive interplay between individual needs and societal needs is critical to success.

Your focus in Eco will be on managing your individual progress while simultaneously working to progress the [Economy|Economy Overview] as a whole, and doing so inside a rich [Ecosystem|Ecosystem Overview] of plants and animals that are affected by what you do.

To aid in creating a positive relationship between this triangle of Individuals, Economy, and Ecosystem, you have the tools of [Government|Government Overview] at your disposal. You can set binding [Laws] that determine what is allowed and run for [Election|Elections] to gain governmental powers to make changes and guide society.
But first matters first, you'll need to take care of your basic needs before you can save the world.  To do that, you'll start with [Food and Shelter].

It will not be an easy task, and the industry required to reach such levels of advancement will pose a real threat to the [Ecosystem|Ecosystem Overview].  To combat this and avoid falling victim to an ecological collapse of your own creation, a well-regulated [Government|Government Overview] must be designed, implemented, and created by its citizens.
The fate of the world depends on its citizens acting together in harmony with the ecosystem to achieve great technological feats, and only through studied collaboration can they succeed.

column1: A foundational goal of the ecosystem simulation in Eco is to contain a multitude of food webs. Food webs can be thought of as a set of 'consumer' and 'consumed' relationships between plants and animals that centers on a particular community of animals and their favorite foods. In general, the idea is to have at least one strong food web present in each biome. Food webs often are the basis of the most important inter and intra-relationships between species in an ecosystem. Many species rely on other species for food, or to hunt the species that is eating them.

Animal's prey and predators can be viewed through the web interface and checking the linked layers. Currently the prey-predator relationship is one way: the predators require the prey to exist, but they don't actually remove any from the simulation. This means that an explosion of elk would increase the wolf population, but this wouldn't put pressure onto the elk. Changing this relationship to consume both ways while ensuring it doesn't spiral out of control in an unexpected and sudden way is important as we move forward.

column1: [Engineers|Engineer] specialize in producing vehicles and advanced crafting materials for use by other professions.
- [BasicEngineeringSkill] allows citizens to produce roads and carts to help with transportation. In addition, basic engineering creates the crafting tables necessary to process and smelt ore.
- [MechanicsSkill] allows to citizens to create early motorized vehicles, like a [SteamTruckItem]. Mechanics provides the first source of electric power to help enable tecnological progression.
- [IndustrySkill] allows citizens to create advanced vehicles, like an [ExcavatorItem] that can quickly collect large amounts of natural resources.
- [OilDrillingSkill] allows citizens to use a [PumpJackItem] to collect [PetroleumItem] for use in fuel and a variety of industrial projects.

- [ElectronicsSkill] uses expensive ingredients to produce the most advanced materials needed for modern crafting projects. In addition to providing a source of green electricity, electronics is used to craft the [LaserItem] needed to save the world from the meteor.

column2: 农民

column1: [Farmers|Farmer] are specialists in agriculture. The crops they produce are a primary source of the calories needed for citizens to perform work.
- [GatheringSkill] allows citizens to harvest more produce from both wild plants and human-created farms.
- [FarmingSkill] allows citizens to create seeds out of produce to help create large farms.
- [FertilizersSkill] allows citizens craft fertilizer and test soil conditions with a [SoilSamplerItem].
- [MillingSkill] allows citizens to process produce in a [MillItem] for use by chefs in more advanced recipes.

column2: 猎人

column1: [Hunters|Hunter] are specialists at efficiently hunting animals and preparing meat for use by chefs. The two hunter specialties are closely linked as the animals hunted must be processed before the meat can be used by a chef.
- [HuntingSkill] grants citizens bonus damage when hunting animals and allows them to approach animals at a closer distance without causing them to run.
- [ButcherySkill] allows citizens to process animal carcasses into prepared meat for chefs. The pelts and hides they create can be used for clothing and other crafting projects.

column2: 石匠

column1: [Masons|Mason] are specialists at mining and working with stone. They provide a valuable source of building material and furniture for homes. The ore they collect is used by Smiths to smelt metal bars.
-[MiningSkill] allows citizens to expend less calories while mining stone and ore. Miners also process collected ore to be used for smelting.
-[MasonrySkill] allows citizens to produce [MortarItem], a primary ingredient for most mason building materials. The [MortaredStoneItem] they produce is a great source of early housing material.
-[PotterySkill] allows citizens to craft [BrickItem] building material and furniture out of [ClayItem].
-[GlassworkingSkill] allows citizens to create [GlassItem] and later [FramedGlassItem]. Glass is a nice supplemental buildling material and is used in a variety of industrial projects.
-[AdvancedMasonrySkill] is a high-level mason skill that produces the finest quality Ashlar Stone building material and furniture.

column2: 铁匠

column1: [Smiths|Smith] specialize in smelting ore and making tools for other citizens using the metal bars they create.
- [SmeltingSkill] allows citizens to smelt the metal bars that make up the foundation of technological advancement. The iron tools they create provide significant benefit over the early stone tools.

- [AdvancedSmeltingSkill] allows citizens to further refine iron bars into [Steel|SteelBarItem] for use in industry and high-tier building materials. Citizens with this specialty can use the steel they create more advanced tools.

column2: 裁缝

column1: The [Tailor] specializes in making high end furniture and specialized clothing that provide bonuses when worn. Unlike most professions, there is only one Tailor specialty.

- [TailoringSkill] allows citizens to create [ClothItem] to create high quality furniture and for use in crafting projects by a variety of professions. The clothing tailors create provides citizens with special bonuses. For example, a [BigBackpackItem] has a higher maximum weight limit than the starter [BasicBackpackItem].

column2: 生存专家

column1: [Survivalists|Survivalist] specializes in carrying extra weight and reducing the calories expended when using basic tools. All citizens are survivalists in the world of Eco.

- Experience in [SelfImprovementSkill] is gained anytime a citizen levels up another specialty. Self-improvement has two main benefits. As citizens progress, they will have increased carry weight capacity and a larger stomach capacity for extra calories. In addition, less calories are consumed when using hammers and shovels.

column2: A general overview of the current economy that contains information such as available trades, work parties, and contracts.

The Economy Viewer provides a general overview of the current economy and is an incredibly useful tool for economic participation. Among other users, the Economy Viewer shows the location of every [StoreItem] and what is currently being bought and sold.

column1: The Economy Viewer provides detailed information about the following:
- Current [Trade] offers
- Existing [Work Parties] and their status
- Any [Contracts] that are posted
- Locations of [Public Crafting Stations|Crafting Component]
- Information on existing [Currencies|Currency]
In additon, the Economy Viewer allows citizens to directly transfer currency to other citizens and quickly check the status of their own [Bank Accounts] and any outstanding debts.

column2: Accessing the Economy Viewer
The Economy Viewer can be accessed by clicking the Economy button located at the bottom right of the screen.
Feeding the World

column1: Food forms the backbone of a growing society in Eco, fueling the increase in skills needed to build a civilization.  A well-organized network of food producers, from farmers to chefs, ensures that citizens gain skills at the rate they need.
